member.name: T:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationRelayService
member.summary: RoleAdministration interface defines APIs which are exposed to work with RoleAdministration data via Admin Service Bus Relay

GetConstraintValuesOfSubject API returns a list of subject constraint entries for an existing subject, where each entry contrains attributes and constraint values for given subject, role and/or permission combination.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is not audited.

Specified subject should already exist in the system. Note that only those constraint template attributes will return which are either associated to role or to permission. If they are associated to permission then permisison to role and role to subject link will also be considered while returning attributes. This API returns attribute with values if they are already set earlier otherwise values will be empty.

example.para: Use below code to get subject constraint attributes

member.summary: Assigns the constraint value to subject.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.

example.para: Use below code to get subject constraint attributes

member.summary: Unassigns the constraint value from subject.

example.para: Use below code to get subject constraint attributes

member.summary: CreateSubject API is used to create Subjects in specified AuthenticationRealm.
member.param: Subject collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationRelayService.UpdateSubject(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Subject})
member.summary: UpdateSubject API is used to update existing Subjects in specified AuthenticationRealm.
member.param: Subject collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

SubjectKey member of Subject is mandatory for Update operation. NewSubjectKey can be used with Update operation if you want to update Key of the Subject. Only Key can be updated using NewSubjectKey. You cannot update RealmName using NewSubjectKey; if new value specified for RealmName, it will be ignored.

example.para: Use below code to update Subject which already exists in AuthenticationRealm called redmond.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationRelayService.SearchSubjects(Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.SubjectSearchCriteria,Microsoft.IT.Security.Core.DataEntities.Page)
member.summary: SearchSubjects API is used to search Subjects as per specified search criteria.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.CreateRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role})
member.summary: CreateRole API is used to create Roles in specified NamedProtectionDomain. Multiple Roles can be created in a single call as API signature supports bulk operation.
member.param: Role collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the limit is 20.

Policy Administration Point Integration: When role is created in RoleAdministration, rule needs to create in PolicyAdministrationPoint. It will have one target for this role. CreateRule is called to perform this operation.

RoleKey member of Role class is required in Create operation. NewRoleKey object will be ignored in this operation. Description and Status are optional to specify. TrustLevel property of Role class should not be used as it will be deprecated in the future.

example.para: Use below code to create a new Role in NamedProtectionDomain called MyBusinessDomain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.UpdateRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role})
member.summary: UpdateRole API is used to update existing Roles in specified NamedProtectionDomain. Multiple Roles can be updated in a single call as API signature supports bulk operation.
member.param: Role collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

Policy Administration Point Integration: When Role is updated, Target attribute value of Policy, Rule object of Permission PolicySet needs to update. Target attribute value is updated to new value of role. UpdateTargetAttributes of PolicyAdministrationPoint API is used to perform this update operation.

RoleKey member of Role is mandatory for Update operation. NewRoleKey can be used with Update operation if you want to update RoleName. Only RoleName can be updated using NewRoleKey. You cannot update NamedProtectionDomain using NewRoleKey and even if new value specified for NamedProtectionDomain, it will be ignored.

example.para: Use below code to update Role which already exists in NamedProtectionDomain called MyBusinessDomain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.DeleteRole(Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)
member.summary: DeleteRole API is used to delete existing Roles in specified NamedProtectionDomain.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
Cacade Delete: It should also remove all the associated objects.
Only RoleKey object of Role class is required for this operation. All other members of Role class are ignored.

example.para: Use below code to delete existing Role from NamedProtectionDomain called MyBusinessDomain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.GetRole(Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)

member.returns: Role object populated with RoleKey and Description members. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is not audited.

* and ? wildcards are supported for all criteria of type string.
Page Size must be between 1 and 1000.

Use below code to search roles assigned to a subject.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.AssignRoleToRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role},Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)
member.summary: AssignRoleToRole API is used to assign one or more than one roles as junior roles to a specific role. It can also be used for external role linking.
member.param: The role which will be a senior role in the hierarchical relation to be created. Details of class.
A list of (one or more) roles that will be junior roles(s) in the hierarchical relation to be created. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

RoleKey member of Role class is required in this operation. NewRoleKey and other objects will be ignored in this operation. All roles specified in the operation are expected to be existing. In the case of external role linking the business domain of the senior role should be in some ancestry of the business domain of the specified junior roles.

example.para: Use below code to create a hierarchical relation between a ProjectLead and DevLead, TestLead roles in MyBusinessDomain business domain.

Use below code to create an external role link between the Auditor role in a parent business domain with the Auditor role in a child business domain, where MyBusinessDomain is the parent business domain of the MyChildBusinessDomain business domain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.UnassignRoleFromRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role},Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)
member.summary: UnassignRoleFromRole API is used to unassign one or more junior roles from the specificed senior role. It can also be used for de-linking externally linked roles.
member.param: The role which is a senior role in the role hierarchy w.r.t. the specified junior roles. Details of class.
A list of (one or more than one) roles that are junior role(s) in the hierarchy and are to be unassigned from the specified senior role. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

RoleKey member of Role class is required in this operation. NewRoleKey and other objects will be ignored in this operation. All roles specified in the operation are expected to be existing. Also each junior role should be some descendant of the specified senior role.

example.para: Use below code to remove the hierarchical relation between a ProjectLead and DevLead, TestLead roles in a business domain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.AssignPermissionToRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Permission},Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)
member.summary: AssignPermissionToRole API is used to assign permissions to role and then these permissions can be granted to subject via Subject to Role assignment APIs e.g. AssignSubjectToRole or AssignRoleToSubject
member.param: Permissions collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

Policy Administration Point Integration: When Permission is assigned to Role, Permission PolicySet needs to update. If Permission PolicySet already contains Policy and Rule then Rule Target Value is updated and assigned role value is appended to the Target attribute value separated by comma. Like Target[0].AttributeValue = Reader,Owner,Contributor;
If Permission PolicySet doesnt contain Policy and Rule then new rule is created with one Target. Target attribute value is set to assigned role value. New policy is created and assign newly created rule to policy. Policy in turn assign to Permission PolicySet.
Below PolicyAdministrationPoint APIs are called to perform these operations
GetPolicySetByPermission
GetRuleVersion
UpdateTargetAttributes
Or
GetPolicySetByPermission
CreateRule
CreatePolicy
AssignRulesToPolicy
AssignPoliciesToPolicySet
All specified permissions and role should exist in the system before you can perform assignment operation.

example.para: Use below code to assign permissions to role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.UnassignPermissionFromRole(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Permission},Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.Role)
member.summary: UnassignPermissionFromRole API is used to unassign permissions from role and hence these permissions can be revoked from all subjects which are associated with this role.
member.param: Permissions collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

Policy Administration Point Integration: When Permission is unassigned from Role then Rule Target of Permission PolicySet needs to update. Rule Target Value is updated and unassigned role value is removed from comma separated attribute values. Below PolicyAdministrationPoint APIs are called to perform these operations
GetPolicySetByPermission
GetRuleVersion
UpdateTargetAttributes
All specified permissions and role should exist in the system and permissions are already assign to role before you can perform unassignment operation.

example.para: Use below code to unassign permissions from role.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.

Policy Administration Point Integration: If permission is already created using this resource then permission policyset would exist in PolicyAdministrationPoint. Permission policyset have two Target Attributes (ResourceName and ActionName) and two SearchTargets (ResourceName and ActionName). ResouceName is referenced in both Target and SearchTarget. Both these references need to update when resource is updated hence this call in turn calls PolicyAdministrationPoint. UpdateTargetAttributes and UpdateSearchTarget API of PolicyAdministrationPoint will be used for this purpose.

ResourceKey object of Resource is mandatory for Update operation. NewResourceKey can be used with Update operation if you want to update ResourceName. Only ResourceName can be updated using NewResourceKey object. You cannot update NamedProtectionDomain; if new value specified for NamedProtectionDomain, it will be ignored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.IRoleAdministrationService.CreatePrivilegeAssignment(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.IT.Security.Administration.RoleAdministration.DataEntities.PrivilegeAssignment})
member.summary: CreatePrivilegeAssignment API is used to create Privilege Assignments. Multiple privilege assignments can be created in a single call as API supports bulk operation.
member.param: PrivilegeAssignment collection to support bulk operation. Details of class.

remarks.para: Audit: This API call is audited.
This method supports bulk operations and the bulk limit is 20.
The dates passed as part of the PrivilegeAssignment objects in the privilegeAssginment collection should be converted to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
To start the privilege assignment immediately, set the UtcStartDateTime to null.
To setup the privilege assignment forever or indefinitely, set the UtcEndDateTime to null.

item.description: UtcStartDateTime should always be in future with respect to current time.
UtcEndDateTime should always be in future with respect to current time.
UtcEndDateTime should always be future with respect to the UtcStartDateTime.

The source subject should have the roles and permissions being granted to the target subject thru the privilege assignment. If the source subject has any of the roles thru delegation, the API would throw a fault.

In case of OBO privilege assignment, the target subject should have the roles and permissions being granted by the source subject. If the target subject has any of the roles thru delegation, the API would throw a fault.

All the permission being assigned thru privilege assignments should be associated to the corresponding roles. If any of the permission is not assigned to the corresponding role, the API would throw a fault.

example.para: Use below code to create a new privilege assignment.
